inlineContent.text: property contains one of the values listed below to tell you what the service does.
Don’t confuse these values with the accessory categories found in

. Despite the similarities, they describe different things. Accessories are the physical objects that the user installs in the home, like a garage door opener. Accessories belong to a particular category, like
Accessories have one or more services that perform tasks. The garage door opener accessory has a garage door opener service with service type
, given below. The same accessory might also have an attached light providing a light bulb service with service type

abstract.text: Configure, control, and communicate with home automation accessories.
A home automation accessory, like a garage door opener or a thermostat.
The primary unit of living space, typically composed of rooms organized into zones.
The manager for a collection of one or more of a user’s homes.
A controllable feature of an accessory, like a light attached to a garage door opener.
The localized description of the service.
A label namespace service used when an accessory supports multiple services of the same type.
The accessory category types supported by HomeKit.
